meta.title: Math MCQs
meta.description: Practice Algebra, Geometry, and Calculus questions

questions.ex: 58 + 97 = 155. Simple addition.
144 divided by 12 is 12.
25 multiplied by 7 equals 175.
First, calculate the sum in the parenthesis: 15 + 5 = 20. Then multiply by 3: 20 × 3 = 60.

questions.q: If you have 24 apples and give away 9, how many do you have left?
questions.ex: 24 - 9 = 15 apples left.

questions.q: A bus travels 60 km in 1 hour. How far does it travel in 3.5 hours?
questions.ex: Distance = Speed × Time. 60 km/h × 3.5 h = 210 km.
Follow order of operations (PEMDAS/BODMAS): 9 × 8 = 72, then 72 + 5 = 77.
72 divided by 9 is 8.

questions.q: If a dozen eggs cost $3, how much does one egg cost?
questions.ex: A dozen is 12. $3 ÷ 12 = $0.25 per egg.
Order of operations: 5 × 5 = 25; 5 ÷ 5 = 1. Then 5 + 25 - 1 = 30 - 1 = 29.

questions.q: If you buy 3 shirts for $15 each, what is the total cost?
questions.ex: 3 shirts × $15/shirt = $45.

questions.q: If a car travels 300 miles on 10 gallons of gas, what is its miles per gallon (MPG)?
questions.ex: 300 miles ÷ 10 gallons = 30 MPG.
Align decimal points: 12.300 + 4.560 + 0.123 = 16.983.

questions.q: Which of the following is a factor of 48?
questions.ex: A factor divides a number completely. 48 ÷ 6 = 8. So, 6 is a factor of 48.

questions.q: What is the least common multiple (LCM) of 9 and 12?
questions.ex: Multiples of 9: 9, 18, 27, 36, 45... Multiples of 12: 12, 24, 36, 48... The LCM is 36.

questions.q: Which of these numbers is a prime factor of 70?
questions.ex: The prime factors of 70 are 2, 5, and 7. Among the options, 7 is a prime factor.

questions.q: What is the greatest common factor (GCF) of 24 and 36?
Which of the following is a multiple of 11?
questions.ex: A multiple of a number is the result of multiplying that number by an integer. 11 × 3 = 33.
The factors of 18 are numbers that divide 18 without a remainder: 1, 2, 3, 6, 9, 18.

questions.q: What are the first five multiples of 7?
questions.ex: Multiples are found by multiplying the number by 1, 2, 3, ... So, 7×1=7, 7×2=14, 7×3=21, 7×4=28, 7×5=35.

questions.q: Is 51 a prime number or a composite number?
questions.ex: 51 is composite because it has factors other than 1 and itself (e.g., 3 × 17 = 51).

questions.q: Which number is a factor of every number?
questions.ex: 1 is a factor of every number because any number divided by 1 is the number itself.

questions.q: Which of these is NOT a factor of 60?
questions.ex: 60 is not divisible by 8 without a remainder (60 ÷ 8 = 7 with remainder 4).

questions.q: What is the smallest multiple of 15 that is greater than 100?
questions.ex: Multiples of 15: ..., 90, 105, 120... The smallest multiple greater than 100 is 105 (15 × 7).

questions.q: The number 2 is the only even ____ number.
questions.ex: 2 is the only even prime number. All other even numbers are divisible by 2.

questions.q: How many factors does a prime number have?
questions.ex: A prime number has exactly two distinct positive divisors: 1 and itself.

questions.q: If a number is a multiple of 6, it must also be a multiple of:?
questions.ex: Since 6 = 2 × 3, any multiple of 6 is also a multiple of its factors, 2 and 3.

questions.q: What is the GCF of 17 and 23?
questions.ex: 17 and 23 are both prime numbers. The GCF of two distinct prime numbers is always 1.

questions.q: What is the LCM of 7 and 11?
questions.ex: Since 7 and 11 are prime numbers, their LCM is their product: 7 × 11 = 77.

questions.q: Which of the following is a common factor of 20 and 50?
questions.ex: Factors of 20: 1, 2, 4, 5, 10, 20. Factors of 50: 1, 2, 5, 10, 25, 50. 10 is a common factor.

questions.q: A number that has more than two factors is called a ____ number.
questions.ex: A composite number is a positive integer that has at least one divisor other than 1 and itself.

questions.q: What is the largest factor of any non-zero number?
questions.ex: The largest factor of any non-zero number is the number itself.

questions.q: Find a number that is a multiple of 5 and a factor of 60.
The GCF of two numbers is 6 and their LCM is 72. If one number is 18, what is the other?
questions.ex: For any two positive integers a and b, GCF(a,b) × LCM(a,b) = a × b. So, 6 × 72 = 18 × x. 432 = 18x. x = 432/18 = 24.

questions.q: Which of these is a multiple of 4 but not a multiple of 8?
questions.ex: 20 is 4 × 5 (multiple of 4). 20 is not divisible by 8.

questions.q: What are the common factors of 12 and 16?
questions.ex: Factors of 12: 1, 2, 3, 4, 6, 12. Factors of 16: 1, 2, 4, 8, 16. Common factors are 1, 2, 4.

questions.q: The product of two numbers is 60. Their GCF is 2. What is their LCM?
questions.ex: Product of numbers = GCF × LCM. So, 60 = 2 × LCM. LCM = 60/2 = 30.

questions.q: Which is the smallest prime number?
questions.ex: The smallest prime number is 2. It is the only even prime number.

questions.q: If a number is divisible by 2 and 3, it must be divisible by:?
questions.ex: If a number is divisible by two co-prime numbers, it is divisible by their product. LCM(2,3)=6.

questions.q: How many prime numbers are there between 1 and 20?
questions.ex: Prime numbers between 1 and 20 are: 2, 3, 5, 7, 11, 13, 17, 19. There are 8 of them.

questions.q: Convert the fraction 3/5 to a decimal.
questions.ex: To convert a fraction to a decimal, divide the numerator by the denominator. 3 ÷ 5 = 0.6.

questions.q: What is 0.25 as a fraction in its simplest form?
questions.ex: 0.25 can be written as 25/100. Simplifying this fraction by dividing both numerator and denominator by 25 gives 1/4.
To add fractions, find a common denominator. 1/2 is equivalent to 2/4. So, 2/4 + 1/4 = 3/4.
0.8 means 8 tenths, which is 8/10. Simplified, this is 4/5.
1.5 multiplied by 3 is 4.5.
Divide both numerator and denominator by their GCF, which is 6. 12÷6=2, 18÷6=3. So, 2/3.
Common denominator is 6. 1/3 = 2/6. So, 5/6 - 2/6 = 3/6, which simplifies to 1/2.
1.75 = 1 and 3/4. As an improper fraction, (1×4 + 3)/4 = 7/4. Or 175/100 simplified is 7/4.
To divide by a fraction, multiply by its reciprocal: (1/2) × (4/1) = 4/2 = 2.
2/3 is approximately 0.666... which is greater than 0.65.
0.05 = 5/100, which simplifies to 1/20.
7 divided by 2 is 3 with a remainder of 1. So, 7/2 = 3 1/2.
Dividing by 0.5 is the same as multiplying by 2. So, 3 × 2 = 6.

questions.q: If a pizza is cut into 8 equal slices and you eat 3, what fraction is left?
questions.ex: If 3 slices are eaten out of 8, then 8 - 3 = 5 slices are left. So, 5/8 is left.
0.75 / 0.25 is the same as 75 / 25, which is 3.
0.12 = 12/100. Dividing numerator and denominator by 4 gives 3/25.
Common denominator is 8. 1/4 = 2/8. So, 5/8 - 2/8 = 3/8.
The third decimal place is 1, which is less than 5, so we round down. 3.14.

questions.q: If 1/3 of a number is 12, what is the number?
Convert the decimal 0.007 to a fraction.
questions.ex: 0.007 has three decimal places, so it is 7/1000.

questions.q: A recipe calls for 2 cups of flour and 1 cup of sugar. What is the ratio of flour to sugar?
questions.ex: The ratio of flour to sugar is 2 cups to 1 cup, which is 2:1.

questions.q: If a $80 item is discounted by 15%, what is the discount amount?
questions.ex: The discount is 15% of $80, which is (15/100) * 80 = $12.

questions.q: The ratio of apples to oranges in a basket is 3:4. If there are 12 apples, how many oranges are there?
questions.ex: Let the ratio be 3x:4x. If 3x = 12, then x = 4. So, oranges = 4x = 4 * 4 = 16.
To express a decimal as a percentage, multiply by 100. So, 0.6 * 100 = 60%.
Divide both parts of the ratio by their GCF, which is 6. 18÷6=3, 24÷6=4. So, 3:4.

questions.q: A store increases the price of a $200 TV by 5%. What is the new price?
If 3 out of 5 students are girls, what percentage of students are girls?
The ratio of the lengths of two ropes is 7:5. If the shorter rope is 25 meters, how long is the longer rope?
questions.ex: Let lengths be 7x and 5x. If 5x = 25m, then x = 5m. Longer rope = 7x = 7*5 = 35m.
To convert a percentage to a decimal, divide by 100. 125/100 = 1.25.

questions.q: A map has a scale of 1:50000. If two towns are 4 cm apart on the map, what is the actual distance?
questions.ex: Actual distance = 4 cm * 50000 = 200000 cm. 200000 cm = 2000 m = 2 km.

questions.q: If you score 45 out of 60 on a test, what is your percentage score?
A mixture contains milk and water in the ratio 5:2. If there are 10 liters of water, how much milk is there?
questions.ex: Let milk be 5x and water be 2x. If 2x = 10L, then x = 5L. Milk = 5x = 5*5 = 25L.

questions.q: If the price of an item decreased from $50 to $40, what is the percentage decrease?
questions.ex: Decrease = $50 - $40 = $10. Percentage decrease = (10/50) * 100% = 20%.

questions.q: The angles of a triangle are in the ratio 1:2:3. What is the measure of the largest angle?
questions.ex: Let angles be x, 2x, 3x. Sum of angles = x + 2x + 3x = 180°. 6x = 180°. x = 30°. Largest angle = 3x = 3*30 = 90°.

questions.q: Convert the fraction 3/20 to a percentage.
A car travels 240 km on 20 liters of petrol. How many km can it travel on 1 liter?
If 60% of a number is 42, what is the number?
questions.ex: Let the number be x. 0.60 * x = 42. So, x = 42 / 0.60 = 70.

questions.q: The ratio of boys to total students in a class is 2:5. If there are 30 students, how many are boys?
Two numbers are in the ratio 4:5. Their sum is 81. Find the numbers.
questions.ex: Let numbers be 4x and 5x. 4x + 5x = 81. 9x = 81. x = 9. Numbers are 4*9=36 and 5*9=45.

questions.q: A salary of $5000 is increased by 8%. What is the new salary?
Express the ratio 1.5 : 2.5 as a simple whole number ratio.
questions.ex: Multiply both by 10 to get 15:25. Then divide by GCF (5) to get 3:5.

questions.q: If a population of a town increased from 10,000 to 12,000, what is the percentage increase?
A recipe needs 3 parts flour to 2 parts sugar. If you use 9 cups of flour, how much sugar is needed?
questions.ex: Ratio flour:sugar = 3:2. If flour is 3x=9, then x=3. Sugar = 2x = 2*3 = 6 cups.
33.33...% is equivalent to 1/3.

questions.q: If an investment of $1000 earns 5% simple interest per year, how much interest is earned in 3 years?
questions.ex: Interest per year = 5% of $1000 = $50. Interest for 3 years = $50 * 3 = $150.

questions.q: The ratio of width to length of a rectangle is 2:3. If the perimeter is 50 cm, find the length.
questions.ex: Let width=2x, length=3x. Perimeter = 2(2x+3x) = 2(5x) = 10x. 10x = 50cm. x = 5cm. Length = 3x = 15cm.

questions.q: What is the square root of 64?
questions.ex: The square root of 64 is 8, because 8 * 8 = 64.
The square root of 121 is 11, as 11 * 11 = 121.
When multiplying powers with the same base, add the exponents: 3^(2+3) = 3^5 = 243.
7 squared (7^2) means 7 * 7 = 49.
Any non-zero number raised to the power of 0 is 1.

questions.q: What is the cube root of 27?
questions.ex: The cube root of 27 is 3, because 3 * 3 * 3 = 27.
When raising a power to another power, multiply the exponents: 4^(3*2) = 4^6 = 4096.
A negative exponent means take the reciprocal of the base raised to the positive exponent: 5^-2 = 1/(5^2) = 1/25.
When dividing powers with the same base, subtract the exponents: 7^(5-3) = 7^2 = 49.

questions.q: If x^2 = 144, what is a possible value of x?

questions.ex: 1 raised to any power is 1.

questions.q: The area of a square is 81 cm². What is the length of its side?
questions.ex: Area of square = side^2. So, side = √Area = √81 = 9 cm.

questions.q: What is the square root of 2 to the nearest whole number?
questions.ex: √2 is approximately 1.414. The nearest whole number is 1.
0 raised to any positive power is 0.
-1 raised to an even power is 1.
9^(1/2) is the same as √9, which is 3.
Combine like terms: (7 - 2 + 5)x = 10x.

questions.q: Evaluate the expression 3a - 2b if a = 5 and b = 3.
questions.ex: Substitute the values: 3(5) - 2(3) = 15 - 6 = 9.
Distribute the 4 to both terms inside the parenthesis: 4*y - 4*3 = 4y - 12.

questions.q: What is the coefficient of x in the expression 5y - x + 9?
questions.ex: The term with x is -x, which can be written as -1x. So the coefficient is -1.
The greatest common factor of 6p and 9q is 3. So, 6p + 9q = 3(2p) + 3(3q) = 3(2p + 3q).

questions.q: What is the value of x^2 - 2x + 1 when x = 3?
Identify the like terms in: 3a + 2b - a + 4b
questions.ex: Like terms have the same variable raised to the same power. So, 3a and -a are like terms, and 2b and 4b are like terms.

questions.q: What is the degree of the polynomial 4x^3 - 2x^2 + 5x - 1?
questions.ex: The degree of a polynomial is the highest power of the variable. Here it is 3.
This is a difference of squares: (a+b)(a-b) = a^2 - ab + ba - b^2 = a^2 - b^2.

questions.q: If p = -2, what is the value of p^3 + 3p^2?

questions.ex: This is a difference of squares: x^2 - 3^2 = (x-3)(x+3).

questions.q: The sum of two numbers is 15 and their product is 50. If the numbers are x and y, which expression represents their product?
questions.ex: The product of x and y is represented by xy.

questions.q: What is the constant term in the expression 2x^2 - 7x + 4?
questions.ex: The constant term is the term without a variable, which is 4.

questions.q: If the length of a rectangle is (x+3) and width is (x-2), what is its area?
questions.ex: Area = length × width = (x+3)(x-2) = x^2 - 2x + 3x - 6 = x^2 + x - 6.
First take out common factor 2: 2(x^2-4). Then factor difference of squares: 2(x-2)(x+2).

questions.q: What is the perimeter of a square with side length (s+1)?
questions.ex: Perimeter of a square = 4 × side length = 4(s+1) = 4s + 4.

questions.q: Evaluate a(b+c) when a=2, b=3, c=-1.
The expression for '5 less than twice a number x' is:
questions.ex: Twice a number x is 2x. 5 less than that is 2x - 5.
We need two numbers that multiply to 12 and add to 7. These are 3 and 4. So, (y+3)(y+4).

questions.q: What is the term for an algebraic expression with only one term?
questions.ex: A monomial is an algebraic expression consisting of one term.

questions.q: If an item costs 'c' dollars and sales tax is 8%, what is the expression for the total cost?
questions.ex: Sales tax amount is 0.08c. Total cost is original cost plus tax: c + 0.08c or 1.08c.

questions.q: The product of a number and 3, increased by 5, is written as:
questions.ex: Let the number be n. Product of n and 3 is 3n. Increased by 5 is 3n + 5.

questions.q: What is the value of p if 4(p - 2) = 16?
The sum of a number and 8 is 20. What is the number?
questions.ex: Let the number be x. x + 8 = 20 => x = 20 - 8 => x = 12.
Multiply by 6 (LCM of 2,3): 3x = 2x + 6 => 3x - 2x = 6 => x = 6.

questions.q: Twice a number decreased by 5 is 13. Find the number.
questions.ex: Let the number be n. 2n - 5 = 13 => 2n = 18 => n = 9.

questions.q: What value of y makes 10 - 2y = 4 true?
If a number is divided by 4 and then 3 is subtracted, the result is 2. What is the number?
questions.ex: Let number be x. x/4 - 3 = 2 => x/4 = 5 => x = 20.

questions.q: The perimeter of a rectangle is 30 cm. If its length is 8 cm, what is its width (w)? (Equation: 2(8+w)=30)
Three consecutive integers sum to 33. If the smallest is x, the equation is x + (x+1) + (x+2) = 33. What is x?
If 8 more than twice a number is 22, what is the number?
questions.ex: Let number be n. 2n + 8 = 22 => 2n = 14 => n = 7.

questions.q: What is the solution to x - 0.2x = 16?
A father is 3 times as old as his son. If the sum of their ages is 48, how old is the son (s)? (Equation: s + 3s = 48)
What is the sum of angles in a triangle?
questions.ex: The sum of the interior angles of a triangle is always 180 degrees.

questions.q: A rectangle has a length of 10 cm and a width of 5 cm. What is its area?
questions.ex: Area of a rectangle = length × width = 10 cm × 5 cm = 50 sq cm.

questions.q: What is the perimeter of a square with a side length of 7 units?
questions.ex: Perimeter of a square = 4 × side length = 4 × 7 = 28 units.

questions.q: The radius of a circle is 4 cm. What is its circumference? (Use π ≈ 3.14)
questions.ex: Circumference of a circle = 2 × π × radius = 2 × 3.14 × 4 cm = 25.12 cm.

questions.q: Which of the following is a property of a parallelogram?
questions.ex: A key property of a parallelogram is that its opposite sides are parallel.

questions.q: What is the volume of a cube with an edge length of 3 cm?
questions.ex: Volume of a cube = edge × edge × edge = 3 cm × 3 cm × 3 cm = 27 cubic cm.

questions.q: An isosceles triangle has two sides of equal length. If one of the equal sides is 5 cm and the base is 6 cm, what is its perimeter?
questions.ex: Perimeter = 5 cm + 5 cm + 6 cm = 16 cm.

questions.q: What is the formula for the area of a triangle?
questions.ex: The area of a triangle is calculated as 0.5 × base × height.

questions.q: How many faces does a cuboid have?
questions.ex: A cuboid has 6 faces.

questions.q: If two lines are perpendicular, what is the angle between them?
questions.ex: Perpendicular lines intersect at a 90-degree angle.

questions.q: What is the name of a polygon with 5 sides?
questions.ex: A polygon with 5 sides is called a pentagon.

questions.q: The diameter of a circle is 10 cm. What is its radius?
questions.ex: Radius = Diameter / 2 = 10 cm / 2 = 5 cm.

questions.q: Which of these shapes has all sides equal and all angles equal to 90 degrees?
questions.ex: A square has all sides equal and all angles equal to 90 degrees.

questions.q: What is the area of a circle with radius 'r'?
questions.ex: The area of a circle is given by the formula A = πr².

questions.q: A triangle has angles 30°, 60°, and 90°. What type of triangle is it?
questions.ex: A triangle with a 90° angle is a right-angled triangle. Since all angles are different, it's also scalene.

questions.q: How many vertices does a triangular prism have?
questions.ex: A triangular prism has 6 vertices (3 on each triangular base).

questions.q: What is the sum of the exterior angles of any convex polygon?
questions.ex: The sum of the exterior angles of any convex polygon is always 360 degrees.

questions.q: A cylinder has a radius of 3 cm and a height of 10 cm. What is its volume? (Use π ≈ 3.14)
questions.ex: Volume of a cylinder = π × radius² × height = 3.14 × (3 cm)² × 10 cm = 282.6 cubic cm.

questions.q: What is the longest chord in a circle called?
questions.ex: The diameter is the longest chord in a circle, passing through the center.

questions.q: If the area of a square is 64 sq units, what is the length of its side?
questions.ex: Side = √Area = √64 = 8 units.

questions.q: How many edges does a cube have?
questions.ex: A cube has 12 edges.

questions.q: A regular hexagon has how many lines of symmetry?
questions.ex: A regular hexagon has 6 lines of symmetry.

questions.q: What is the point of intersection of the medians of a triangle called?
questions.ex: The point of intersection of the medians of a triangle is called the centroid.

questions.q: The measure of an angle is 75 degrees. What is the measure of its complementary angle?
questions.ex: Complementary angles add up to 90 degrees. So, 90 - 75 = 15 degrees.

questions.q: What is the shape of the base of a cone?
questions.ex: The base of a cone is a circle.

questions.q: Two angles are supplementary. If one angle is 120 degrees, what is the other angle?
questions.ex: Supplementary angles add up to 180 degrees. So, 180 - 120 = 60 degrees.

questions.q: What is the formula for the surface area of a sphere with radius 'r'?
questions.ex: The surface area of a sphere is given by the formula A = 4πr².

questions.q: A rhombus has diagonals of length 6 cm and 8 cm. What is its area?
questions.ex: Area of a rhombus = 0.5 × d1 × d2 = 0.5 × 6 cm × 8 cm = 24 sq cm.

questions.q: How many diagonals does a pentagon have?
questions.ex: A pentagon has 5 diagonals. The formula is n(n-3)/2, where n is the number of sides.

questions.q: What is the name for a triangle with all three sides of different lengths?
questions.ex: A triangle with all three sides of different lengths is called a scalene triangle.

questions.q: If sin(θ) = 3/5, what is cos(θ) if θ is an acute angle?
questions.ex: Using sin²(θ) + cos²(θ) = 1, (3/5)² + cos²(θ) = 1 => 9/25 + cos²(θ) = 1 => cos²(θ) = 16/25 => cos(θ) = 4/5 (since θ is acute).

questions.q: What is the value of sin²(θ) + cos²(θ)?
questions.ex: This is a fundamental trigonometric identity: sin²(θ) + cos²(θ) = 1.

questions.q: What is sec(θ) in terms of cos(θ)?
questions.ex: sec(θ) is the reciprocal of cos(θ), so sec(θ) = 1/cos(θ).

questions.q: What is cot(θ) in terms of tan(θ)?
questions.ex: cot(θ) is the reciprocal of tan(θ), so cot(θ) = 1/tan(θ).

questions.q: In a right-angled triangle, the side opposite the right angle is called the?
questions.ex: The side opposite the right angle in a right-angled triangle is called the hypotenuse.

questions.q: If tan(θ) = 1, what is θ (for 0° ≤ θ < 90°)?
What is the range of values for sin(θ)?
questions.ex: The values of sin(θ) range from -1 to 1, inclusive.

questions.q: What is the range of values for cos(θ)?
questions.ex: The values of cos(θ) range from -1 to 1, inclusive.
tan(θ) = sin(θ)/cos(θ).

questions.q: What is cosec(θ) in terms of sin(θ)?
questions.ex: cosec(θ) is the reciprocal of sin(θ), so cosec(θ) = 1/sin(θ).

questions.q: The angle of elevation of a ladder leaning against a wall is 60° and the foot of the ladder is 4.6 m away from the wall. What is the length of the ladder?
questions.ex: cos(60°) = adjacent/hypotenuse = 4.6/L. Since cos(60°) = 0.5, 0.5 = 4.6/L => L = 4.6/0.5 = 9.2 m.
tan(90°) = sin(90°)/cos(90°) = 1/0, which is undefined.

questions.q: If cos(θ) = 12/13, what is sin(θ) if θ is an acute angle?

questions.ex: This is the double angle formula for sine: sin(2θ) = 2sin(θ)cos(θ). So, 2sin(30°)cos(30°) = sin(2×30°) = sin(60°). sin(60°) = √3/2.
The sum formula for sine is sin(A + B) = sinAcosB + cosAsinB.
The difference formula for cosine is cos(A - B) = cosAcosB + sinAsinB.
To convert degrees to radians, multiply by π/180. So, 180 × (π/180) = π radians.
To convert radians to degrees, multiply by 180/π. So, (π/3) × (180/π) = 60°.

questions.q: What is the period of the function y = sin(x)?
questions.ex: The period of y = sin(x) is 2π, meaning the function repeats every 2π interval.

questions.q: What is the period of the function y = tan(x)?
questions.ex: The period of y = tan(x) is π, meaning the function repeats every π interval.

questions.q: If a right triangle has legs of length 3 and 4, what is the length of the hypotenuse?
questions.ex: By Pythagorean theorem, a² + b² = c². So, 3² + 4² = c² => 9 + 16 = c² => 25 = c² => c = 5.

questions.q: What is the value of sec²(θ) - tan²(θ)?
questions.ex: This is a Pythagorean identity: 1 + tan²(θ) = sec²(θ), so sec²(θ) - tan²(θ) = 1.
